decks.notes: The primary focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. With cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an additional threat to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements while also providing flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a game of attrition.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and quick damage output. By utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan and Phlage, along with support cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of Ajani and Voice of Victory provides additional support and buffs to the creatures on the battlefield. The deck also features removal spells like Thraben Charm and control elements such as Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With a mix of creature aggression and control elements, this deck aims to dominate the battlefield swiftly.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By combining cards that disrupt the opponent's resources such as Thoughtseize and Teferi, Time Raveler with aggressive creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, the deck seeks to control the game's tempo and dictate the pace of play. Additionally, the deck utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and quickly close out the game with aggressive creatures.

The core strategy of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells to dominate the game. Karn, the Great Creator is a key card in the deck, allowing for versatile disruption and artifact removal. The Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths provide additional control and threats on the board, while Ugin, the Eye of the Storms offers powerful board control and removal options.

This deck revolves around using Jeskai Ascendancy and various artifact creatures to generate infinite mana and cards, allowing for a powerful combo finish. The key strategy is to constantly dig through the deck with cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, while controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt. With the right pieces in play, the deck can quickly amass a significant advantage and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and activations.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to quickly ramp into big threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer, while also having a variety of removal options like Dismember and All Is Dust. The deck's win condition involves overwhelming the opponent with large Eldrazi creatures and powerful planeswalkers, making it difficult for them to recover.

The key concept of this Control - UrzaTron deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) in order to generate a large amount of mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and control spells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker, while also utilizing versatile cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, Eye of the Storms for additional control and board presence. The deck also includes various disruption and removal spells to deal with threats and maintain board control.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage, while using Teferi, Time Raveler to protect the player's spells and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes powerful control elements like Counterspell, Wrath of the Skies, and Teferi, as well as utility cards like Prismatic Ending and Ephemerate. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage and Quantum Riddler allows for versatility in casting spells from the graveyard and digging for answers when needed. With a combination of control and card advantage, this deck aims to outlast and outplay the opponent in a long game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to play efficient threats like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off the opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory to generate additional value and push through damage. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistency and allow for smooth curve-outs.

The deck revolves around using Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite along with Splinter Twin to create an infinite combo, allowing for a quick win condition. The deck also includes a control element with cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Negation, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Psychic Frog offer card advantage and filtering to support the combo. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes some dual lands for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to achieve a quick and decisive victory through its powerful combo pieces.

Utilizing artifacts for ramp and card advantage, this deck aims to flood the board with creatures and quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By leveraging cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to power out threats early, the deck can also disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Metallic Rebuke. With a mix of efficient creatures and powerful spells, this deck seeks to establish an early advantage and close out games before the opponent can recover.

The main concept of the deck is to combo off without the need for lands, using a variety of disruptive spells and control elements to protect the combo pieces. Cards like Disrupting Shoal and Spell Snare are used to counter opponent's threats, while cards like Whir of Invention and Lotus Bloom are used to set up the combo with cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Tameshi, Reality Architect. The deck also utilizes bounce spells like Into the Flood Maw and suppression effects like Suppression Ray to control the board and protect its win conditions.

The deck revolves around creating a powerful combo with Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker, utilizing cards like Eldrazi Temple and Blade of the Bloodchief to boost their effectiveness. It also includes disruption tools like Thoughtseize and Malevolent Rumble to control the opponent's resources. The deck combines efficient mana ramp with powerful creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. It also includes various utility lands and cards like Urza's Saga to enhance its strategy. The key is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and outvalue the opponent before they can respond effectively.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the board through removal spells and counterspells, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Relic of Progenitus and Crucible of Worlds. It aims to maintain control of the game through card advantage and tempo plays, eventually winning through incremental advantage with cards like Solitude and March of Otherworldly Light. The deck utilizes a mix of removal, counterspells, and card advantage engines to outlast and outmaneuver the opponent in the long game.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and fast mana to quickly play powerful threats and disrupt the opponent. It takes advantage of the affinity mechanic to reduce the cost of its artifacts, allowing for explosive turns and overwhelming board presence. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells and removal, as well as card draw to keep the hand full. By combining speed, synergy, and versatility, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures through cards like Faithless Looting and Thought Scour, then use reanimation spells like Unearth and Persist to bring back powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones onto the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. This combo-centric deck relies on strategic graveyard manipulation and reanimation to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.
